dt: {bc}to decide not to conduct or perform (something planned or expected) usually without expectation of conducting or performing it at a later time
{bc}to destroy the force, effectiveness, or validity of {bc}{sx|annul||}

dt.t: his irritability {wi}canceled{/wi} out his natural kindness

dt: {bc}to withdraw one's support for (someone, such as a celebrity, or something, such as a company) publicly and especially on social media

dt.t: … the internet has {wi}canceled{/wi} her over her alleged anti-black and homophobic past.

dt: {bc}to deface (a postage or revenue stamp) especially with a set of ink lines so as to {d_link|invalidate|invalidate} for reuse
{bc}to remove (equivalents) on opposite sides of an equation or account
{bc}to mark or strike out for deletion
{bc}to neutralize each other's strength or effect {bc}{sx|counterbalance||}

dt.t: the various pressure groups to a large degree {wi}canceled{/wi} out

et: Middle English {it}cancellen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}canceller, chanceller{/it}, from Late Latin {it}cancellare{/it}, from Latin, to make like a lattice, from {it}cancelli{/it} (plural), diminutive of {it}cancer{/it} lattice, probably alteration of {it}carcer{/it} prison
shortdef: to decide not to conduct or perform (something planned or expected) usually without expectation of conducting or performing it at a later time
to destroy the force, effectiveness, or validity of : annul
to match in force or effect : offset —often used with out

dt: {bc}to reduce the effect of (something) {bc}to be equal to (something) in force or importance but have an opposite effect

shortdef: to reduce the effect of (something) : to be equal to (something) in force or importance but have an opposite effect
